candidates.name: Marsha Blackburn
candidates.bio: Close ally of President Trump with statewide name recognition from two Senate elections. If elected, would be Tennessee's first female governor and would appoint her own Senate replacement.
politicalBackground: Led fight against proposed TN state income tax
keyFacts: Beacon Center poll: 68% among Republican voters
33,000 contributions broke the state filing system
Campaign treasurer: Knox County Mayor Glenn Jacobs
Would appoint her own Senate replacement if elected

candidates.name: John Rose
candidates.bio: Family farmer, IT businessman, and former Commissioner of Agriculture. Self-funded $5M and already running TV ads statewide. 92% of contributions from Tennessee donors.
politicalBackground: U.S. Representative, TN-6 (2019-present, not seeking re-election)
Commissioner of Agriculture under Bredesen & Haslam (2002-2018)

educationStance.teacherPay: Pledged to appoint a teacher as education commissioner

keyFacts: Self-funded $5M personal loan to campaign
92% of contributions from Tennessee donors
Only candidate running statewide TV and mail ads
First major Republican candidate to formally enter
His TN-6 Congressional seat will be open Nov 2026

candidates.name: Monty Fritts
candidates.bio: Anti-establishment Army veteran and Y-12 nuclear complex manager. One of ~20 House Republicans to vote against school vouchers. Announced at Washington County GOP 'Trump Day' dinner.

educationStance.schoolChoice: ANTI-voucher â€” one of ~20 House Republicans to vote against
educationStance.teacherPay: Supports teacher raises through state spending cuts

keyFacts: Voted against school vouchers (HB1)
Called for execution of parents/doctors of trans children (Jan 2026)
Slogan: 'Liberty & Less Government'
Anti-establishment positioning against Blackburn
controversies: Jan 29, 2026: Podcast appearance advocating capital punishment for parents, guardians, and doctors involved in gender-affirming care for minors. Went viral via Right Wing Watch.

candidates.name: Cito Pellegra
candidates.bio: Ballot-only candidate. No campaign website, no finance reports, no public platform, no media coverage.

candidates.name: Jerri Green
candidates.bio: Georgetown Law grad, former public defender, three-time gun violence survivor. Only Democrat with current elected office. Running on 'army of moms' coalition and public school funding.
politicalBackground: Candidate for TN House District 83 (2020, lost)
Director of Community Engagement, Community Legal Center
Statewide election lead, TN Moms Demand Action

educationStance.schoolChoice: Emphasis on funding public schools over alternatives
educationStance.earlyChildhood: Expanded pre-K and youth programming as council member

keyFacts: Only Democrat with current elected office experience
Georgetown Law graduate, former public defender
Three-time gun violence survivor
Campaign slogan: 'One Tough Mother'
Running on 'army of moms' coalition strategy

candidates.name: Carnita Atwater
candidates.bio: Museum president and Memphis community leader. Third gubernatorial attempt. Ran for governor in 2022 (3rd in Dem primary) and Memphis mayor in 2023. First African American woman to run for TN governor.
politicalBackground: Candidate for Governor (2022, 3rd place in Dem primary with ~18%)
Candidate for Mayor of Memphis (2023, lost)
President, African American International Museum Foundation
keyFacts: First African American woman to run for TN governor
Third run for major office in 4 years
Focused on racial equity and community advocacy

candidates.name: Adam "Ditch" Kurtz
candidates.bio: Nashville musician running no-corporate-money grassroots campaign. Supports free healthcare, eliminating grocery tax, raising minimum wage, legalizing marijuana with tax revenue to schools.

educationStance.earlyChildhood: Free pre-K for all Tennessee children
educationStance.funding: Legalize marijuana, tax revenue to public schools

keyFacts: No-corporate-money pledge, small donors only
Friends with Rep. Gloria Johnson
Campaign launch at The 5 Spot, East Nashville

candidates.name: Tim Cyr
candidates.bio: 'Tennessee Tim' moved to TN in 2017. Previously ran for Illinois House in 2010. Ballot-only candidate.
keyFacts: Previously ran for Illinois House (2010, lost)

candidates.name: Stephen Maxwell
candidates.bio: Military veteran (PTSD), nonprofit director, minister. Most detailed platform among independents. Completed Ballotpedia survey.
keyFacts: Oppose REAL ID, TSA, Patriot Act
40% farmer stimulus
Require 90/95 counties approve state budget
Most detailed independent platform

candidates.name: Lauren Pinkston
candidates.bio: Filed as independent. No public profile.

candidates.name: Manasa Reddy
candidates.bio: Filed as independent. No public profile.

candidates.name: Robert Vick
candidates.bio: Filed as independent. No public profile.

watchlist.name: Glenn Jacobs
watchlist.note: Endorsed Blackburn, serving as campaign treasurer
